newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: PERSETEL ACTIVE ON BOOKOVER, FOREIGN BUY.
newsitem.headline: PERSETEL ACTIVE ON BOOKOVER, FOREIGN BUY.

text.p: A bookover of 800,000 shares and a foreign purchase deal by stockbroking firms UBS Securities and SocGen Frankel Pollak, respectively, pushed South African computer firm Persetel higher on Monday, making it one of the biggest movers on the Johannesburg bourse, dealers said.

An equities trader at UBS Securites said the bookover deal was worth around 26.4 million rand while a dealer at Societe Generale Frankel Pollak said Friday's late foreign purchase deal was valued at around 1.5 million rand.
The dealer added that the purchase deal had involved 47,600 shares.
A bookover occurs when a single brokerage matches both buyer and seller.
By about 1345 GMT Persetel Holdings Ltd's stock was up 20 cents at 33.10 rand after 1.5 million shares worth around 49.6 million rand had changed hands.
The stock was last indicated as the sixth most active stock by moves on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange.
